Subject: RE: [junit] Getting TestResult from TestRunner in Eclipse
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=135164432


Thomas,

When you talk about the daily test results, are you running a nightly suite
of tests from Eclipse?  Because that's a job for Ant.  I bet I'm merely
misunderstanding you.  Also, from Ant, it would be easier to extend Ant's
runner to collect test results and post them to a database.  Get that
figured out, then extending the Eclipse runner has got to be easier.

As for tests being run twice in Eclipse, instead of the run configuration
running any and all tests it can find (which includes the suites AND the
tests individually), you should select the base suite to run.  That will run
the tests once.  Alternatively, get rid of the suites, and let Eclipse
and/or Ant find all your test classes for you.

Good luck,
-Larry

-----Original Message-----
From: Thomas.Bruenjes@... [mailto:Thomas.Bruenjes@...]

Sent: Thursday, November 18, 2004 11:49 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Getting TestResult from TestRunner in Eclipse



Hallo,
I want to write the daily testresults and logfiles from JUnit and HttpUnit
into a testcase database.
Thats means run tests, write log, connect database. But in Eclipse run the
tests twice, because the JUnit plugin gets the suite and
let them run. When I choice "Run as Application" in Eclipse the tests run
once, but I loose the GUI-Information from JUnit-Plugin.
How do I get the TestResult object from Testrunner to participate the
results that I need to archive? Overload run (but how an where)? Wrap suite
(but how an where)?

Thanks for help!
Thomas

public class T8TDHttpTestMain extends TestCase {
	
  static {
		T8TDConnector TDCo = new T8TDConnector(); // my connection
class
		TDCo.runTest(suite(),"T8TDHttpTestMain"); // do
"suite.run(testresult);" and 
                                                      // log and write to
DB.
  }

  public static void main( String args[] ) {
     // ... not important
  }

  public static Test suite() {
		TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
		suite.addTestSuite(T8TDHttpTestDrv.class);
		return suite;
  }

}
